summary: This is an email from attorney Mariann Wang to an unspecified recipient (likely a prosecutor or investigator) canceling a scheduled meeting with her client, who is a victim or witness regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The client is unwilling to participate in another interview due to emotional exhaustion and the belief her information would not materially advance ongoing prosecutions.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: She is the sender of the email, communicating on behalf of her client to cancel a meeting with prosecutors or investigators regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: She is copied on the email, suggesting she may also be involved in the legal representation or the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is referenced as the subject of the client's interactions and the ongoing prosecutions.

connections.description: Mariann Wang is acting as legal counsel for the unnamed client, communicating the client's decision to cancel a meeting.
The client has had interactions with Jeffrey Epstein that she has had to recount multiple times, indicating she is likely a victim or witness.
Both are attorneys; Allred is copied on the email, suggesting a professional association or shared involvement in the case.

events.title: Cancelled Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: A scheduled meeting between the unnamed client and prosecutors/investigators was cancelled at the client's request.

keyFacts: An unnamed client of attorney Mariann Wang, who had interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, refused to participate in another interview with prosecutors in April 2021.
The client's refusal was due to emotional exhaustion from having to recount her interactions with Epstein multiple times.
The client believed her information would not materially advance the ongoing prosecutions against Epstein or his associates.
The communication indicates ongoing investigative or prosecutorial efforts related to Epstein were active as of April 2021.
